comment: I had this professor my first year at KSU and she was pretty cool. I took her for Psych 1101. She's very friendly & usually clear on her assignments. Every test we took we had a group review which was pretty helpful! Would definitely take her again, I passed her class with an A.

I enjoyed class with Professor Burr. She really knows her stuff. Easy class. Attendance is mandatory. Four exams including final. Final is not cumulative. She gives us an exam review the class before each  exam so you have the opportunity  to review actual exam questions. Would take her again. Definitely recommend her.

This course consisted of aspects of psychology that would be considered 'clickbait'. To open class, Dr. Burr suggested that we question everything, including both planets and gravity. She proved to be difficult in communicating as well; during a project, I contacted her to sort out an issue with my group. She didn't offer any help with the subject.

2nd time taking Burr! She is AMAZING. Rule to live by: it's on the syllabus. Reading is required for this course. Tests were a little difficult, that's due to the book and who wrote it (they supply the test). 1 group presentation. Follow grading rubric for assignments  A. Definitely show up for test reviews.  She is always there for help.

Clarity on assignments were slim to none. Directions and rubrics for major  (lengthy) assignments were provided a week before they were due.  I would NOT recommend this professor.  Although this is a senior level course,  clarity on assignments can make or break your grade. Takes forever to grade assignments. Two thumbs down.

Pretty easy class, as long as you show up and do her busy work. Attendance is mandatory, and if you are absent on the day she gives an assignment for homework, she won't give you credit. Test review sessions are identical to tests. Reminded me of a high school class with her "no cell phone" policy.

Dr. Burr may come off as distant, but she is more than fair and more than willing to help out if you ask. Let me repeat, IF YOU ASK. She is not a mind reader. Nor does she believe college should be about hand holding. This is a 4000 level course. That being said, pay attention in class and read the book (I didn't but that's just how I roll).

She is very rude to students who have questions about her assignments, test or anything dealing with your grade. Her clarity on assignments that are due is weak. If you miss a class period you will not receive credit for assignments. Reads off a power point. Do not take her unless you have a lot of time on your hands.

She only has four test out of the year so If you miss one you are screwed. She prides herself off of the fact that if 80% of the class did it right there is no need for complaints. She tells you to refer to the syllabus anytime you have a problem. You miss a class you cant turn in the next assignment. Her clarity on when the test are due is vague.

This was a hybrid class. Exams are easy, online, and answers can be Googled. Final exam is not cumulative. Attendence is not mandatory but to get credit for participation projects you have to attend the class where it was assigned even tho it is online. She lectures from pwrpnts. Boring! She's about 10-15min late every week. Can sign in and leave!

Loved her class. She does some activities throughout the semester that keep you interested in the class. She is super nice and funny. For review, she puts you in teams and you play a game as a class. It's very fun and helpful. Overall, she is my favorite professor so far.

This class was a hybrid and really easy. Reading (text and Power Points) is done at home. Class time was for applying the material. Participation projects are assigned during class and you only get credit if you attended. All tests were online and taken at home. Show up, act like an adult, and do the work and there's no reason you can't get an A.
She's really helpful

I wouldn't recommend this professor. Her lectures are usually dry.  She doesn't particularly seem to enjoy teaching either. Her lectures are basically reading off the powerpoints. Don't bother arguing about assignment grades or confusing test questions -- it won't help. Don't expect much extra credit because hardly any is offered.

Not an easy class. There were changes to syllabus.  Lectures were not very helpful. Assignment directions were spotty. Tests were straightforward, but the other assignments were tough. Attendance was not required, but the tests are easier if you attend. I wouldn't take this prof again.

Would not recommend! This class is harder than it should be. Tough grader on assignments and only 5 pts possible extra credit out of 550 pts possible in class - that's it. Tests are fairly easy IF you go to the review. GRE assignment will take a lot of time! A lot of busy work required for this class and syllabus is likely to change a few times.

She does not give Extra Credit anymore because people kept commenting on how she offered "too much EC", so her class is not easy. Expect the syllabus to change regularly throughout the semester, including the addition of 3 to 5 assignments. She grades the group projects very hard. I couldn't wait for this class to end.

I would not recomend this professor. Honestly she is all over the place with her directions and she does not meet her own deadlines that she sets. This whole semester was confusing for the whole class.

Clinical was a fun class. She gave us very thought-provoking and hands-on assignments. Tests are very straightforward and lectures are right out of the book. ATTEND THE TEST REVIEW CLASS! She gives review questions from the test. She is not lenient on late work. No emailed work and 10 pts off each day late. Overall, really enjoyed her class.

Overall, this was an easy class. This is the most unclear teacher I have ever had. She changed the syllabus halfway into the class, and it was pretty confusing. It was a hybrid class, and she didn't seem prepared to teach this way. She is a very nice person, and gives TONS of extra credit.

Easy class as long as you read each chapter when she assigns it! She offers enough extra credit to boost your grade at least one whole letter grade, so definitely take advantage of every extra credit opportunity (and they are easy).

The class I took was hybrid. After the second week, she changed discussions to inclass which eliminated teaching time.  The discussions(more like competetions) were graded on who could talk the loudest.  All in all, it was a self taught class. I cannot believe KSU hired her. Worst teacher I have EVER had.
Lovely teacher. Helps you a lot. Read the issues and you will be fine. She gives A LOT of extra credit. DO IT! Quizzes and tests are a piece of cake! TAKE HER!

Great teacher, easy class, and very interesting. This teacher gives so much extra credit it's rediculous. If you do the readings, read the powerpoints and go to class you should get an A. Only problem was that the teacher seemed new and wasn't clear on what she wanted to do or what she wanted from you at times.nice and knows what she talking about.
